messageBody:
>>>>> "Greg" == Greg Stickley <gregstickley@...> writes:

Greg> if this test is running on an instance of Linux without a
Greg> display try exporting your DISPLAY variable to a machine
Greg> that does have a display before running the tests. (export
Greg> DISPLAY=144.230.1.1:0) Then all of the gui rendering will
Greg> leverage the graphics capabilities of the remote X Server.

Greg> Also you could run a virtual display on the testing machine.
Greg> Something like Xvdm which will let you keep the tests
Greg> isolated to a single machine. In this case you would still
Greg> need to export your DISPLAY as above but would look
Greg> something like this "export DISPLAY=localhost:100".

I'd actually tried connecting to an X session I had started on the
local machine, and that still gave the same Connection Refused errors,
even after doing an xhost +. I'll try it again to see if I just left
something out..

Where can I find Xvdm? I've searched google, redhat, and a few other
places, but I can't find it.
